CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of ORG , in the GPE region , GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the ORG - owned mining company “ PERSON ” ( “ the company ” ) to pay the applicant CARDINAL NORP hryvnyas ( ORG ) in salary arrears and other payments . By another decision adopted on DATE the court ordered the company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL for loss of salary and to rectify the records in his work book ( трудова книжка ) about the date and the reason of his dismissal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the same court ordered the company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL for loss of salary and other payments . By the same judgment the court ruled again to rectify the records in his work book about the date of his dismissal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the same court ordered the company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL for loss of salary and other payments . By the same judgment the court ruled to rectify the records in his work book about the date of his dismissal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the same court ordered the company to enforce the judgments of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the same court ordered the company to provide the applicant with an apartment , as stipulated in his employment contract . On DATE the same court , upon the applicant ’s request , modified the manner of enforcement of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and ordered the company to pay the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL instead of providing him with an apartment .
CARDINAL . All the above judgments became final and the enforcement proceedings were instituted by ORG ( “ the Bailiffs Service ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that the enforcement proceedings had been suspended due to bankruptcy proceedings pending against the company .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG seeking compensation for damage caused to him due to the non - enforcement of the above judgments . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s complaints against the alleged inactivity of ORG . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the decision and remitted the case to the first - instance court for a new consideration . According to the applicant ’s submissions , the proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . The applicant rented a house owned by Mr. PERSON . In DATE the applicant instituted proceedings against the municipal company ORG ) , and ORG управління водопровідно каналізаційного господарства ) claiming ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage , alleging that the water supply to the house rented by him was unsatisfactory . The applicant also sought a recalculation of his water rates .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s claims in part . On DATE ORG quashed that decision and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh consideration by another judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s claim in part and awarded him UAH CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed this decision and remitted the case to ORG for a fresh consideration by another judge .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of ORG requested that ORG of Appeal transfer the applicant ’s case to another court on the ground that it only had CARDINAL judges , who had both already considered the case . On DATE ORG granted the request and transferred the case to ORG .
CARDINAL . Meanwhile , the applicant appealed in cassation against the ruling of the court of appeal of DATE . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s cassation appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON . entered the proceedings as a third party . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the applicant ’s claim in part and awarded him UAH CARDINAL in compensation for non - pecuniary damage . On DATE ORG upheld that decision .

CARDINAL . According to the materials in the case file , out of around CARDINAL scheduled hearings , CARDINAL were adjourned due to the absence or at the request of the GPE representatives . CARDINAL were adjourned because of the absence of both parties ; CARDINAL were adjourned because of the absence of the applicant or at his request ; and CARDINAL was adjourned due to the judge ’s illness .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s complaint was transferred to ORG , which left it unexamined on the ground that the dispute fell within the jurisdiction of the commercial courts . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG and ORG , respectively , upheld that ruling .

CARDINAL . On DATE the investigator of ORG of the ORG appointed the applicant , acting as a legal advisor , as legal assistant to a minor , PERSON , who was charged with robbery . On DATE ORG of PERSON annulled this appointment ; on DATE B. ’s mother cancelled the legal aid contract .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgments of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . GPE , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
